headline: How Mag 7's lead over other stocks could shrink in 2026
summary: Yardeni Research president, Ed Yardeni, has changed his tune on the Big Tech trade, effectively switching to Underweight on "Magnificent Seven" stocks. HB Wealth chief market strategist, Gina Martin Adams, joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the health of the Big Tech trade and explain where she sees it heading next year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: How Mag 7's lead over other stocks could shrink in 2026
content.description:
Yardeni Research president, Ed Yardeni, has changed his tune on the Big Tech trade, effectively switching to Underweight on "Magnificent Seven" stocks.

HB Wealth chief market strategist, Gina Martin Adams, joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the health of the Big Tech trade and explain where she sees it heading next year.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Morgan Stanley Hands Tesla Stock A New Rating, Sees Musk Hitting This Many Pay Deal Milestones
summary: Tesla received a price-target hike and a rating change from Morgan Stanley on Sunday as the bank's analyst sees the automaker hitting several of the targets laid out in CEO Elon Musk's new pay package, valued at around $1 trillion.  TSLA shares fell in Monday's stock market and continued to edge lower Tuesday.  Morgan Stanley analyst Andrew Percoco took over from Adam Jonas on Sunday and assumed coverage of Tesla stock with an equal weight rating, giving TSLA a 425 price target.

content.title: Morgan Stanley Hands Tesla Stock A New Rating, Sees Musk Hitting This Many Pay Deal Milestones
content.summary: Tesla received a price-target hike and a rating change from Morgan Stanley on Sunday as the bank's analyst sees the automaker hitting several of the targets laid out in CEO Elon Musk's new pay package, valued at around $1 trillion.  TSLA shares fell in Monday's stock market and continued to edge lower Tuesday.  Morgan Stanley analyst Andrew Percoco took over from Adam Jonas on Sunday and assumed coverage of Tesla stock with an equal weight rating, giving TSLA a 425 price target.

headline: Energy Transition Today - Yəyus Energy: Wind Power and Cultural Empowerment Collaboration
summary: Capstone Infrastructure Corporation and the Wei Wai Kum First Nation have announced the renaming and new branding of the Brewster Wind Project to Yəyus Energy, symbolizing a significant advancement in the energy transition on Vancouver Island. The project, reflecting a partnership between the two entities within the traditional territory of the Ligʷiłdaxʷ peoples, aims to harness wind energy to power over 50,000 homes annually. The renaming underscores the project's commitment to renewable...

headline: Apple’s Slow AI Pace Becomes a Strength as Market Grows Weary of Spending
summary: Through the first six months of 2025, Apple was the second-worst performer among the Magnificent Seven tech giants, as its shares tumbled 18% through the end of June.  “It is remarkable how they have kept their heads and are in control of spending, when all of their peers have gone the other direction,” said John Barr, portfolio manager of the Needham Aggressive Growth Fund, which owns Apple shares.

content.title: Apple’s Slow AI Pace Becomes a Strength as Market Grows Weary of Spending
content.summary: Through the first six months of 2025, Apple was the second-worst performer among the Magnificent Seven tech giants, as its shares tumbled 18% through the end of June.  “It is remarkable how they have kept their heads and are in control of spending, when all of their peers have gone the other direction,” said John Barr, portfolio manager of the Needham Aggressive Growth Fund, which owns Apple shares.

headline: Wall Street Price Prediction: Tesla’s Share Price Forecast for 2025
summary: After soaring in 2023 and 2024, shares of Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) were battered throughout Q1 but performed marginally better in Q2. The largest U.S. EV-maker slid into Q3 but staged a comeback. Things have been looking better in Q4, but after a tech sell-off that began in late October, shares of TSLA were again sliding lower. But ... headline: Tesla Is All-In On Autonomous Driving And AI. Is Rivian Poised To Compete?
summary: Rivian holds its "Autonomy & AI Day" on Thursday at 12 p.m. ET.  While the format and the exact details of the event are still unknown, CEO RJ Scaringe said during the Q3 earnings call on Nov. 4 that Rivian will discuss and share information about its autonomous platform along with the "hardware and software road map" during the Dec. 11 event.  "Over the long term, we expect the industry to be fully electric, autonomous and software defined," Scaringe told analysts last month.

content.title: Tesla Is All-In On Autonomous Driving And AI. Is Rivian Poised To Compete?
content.summary: Rivian holds its "Autonomy & AI Day" on Thursday at 12 p.m. ET.  While the format and the exact details of the event are still unknown, CEO RJ Scaringe said during the Q3 earnings call on Nov. 4 that Rivian will discuss and share information about its autonomous platform along with the "hardware and software road map" during the Dec. 11 event.  "Over the long term, we expect the industry to be fully electric, autonomous and software defined," Scaringe told analysts last month.

headline: She's Holding Onto $650K In Tesla Stock, Waiting For It To Hit $1M. Dave Ramsey Says, 'I'm Not Dissing Tesla, But I'm Not Buying It'
summary: A woman who worked at Tesla for six years is sitting on $650,000 worth of company stock, and she’s hoping it grows to $1 million before she sells. The 37-year-old project engineer earns $70,000 a year, rents for $1,000 a month, and has $20,000 in debt she plans to pay off this year. Despite having no cash savings, she’s holding onto the stock, nervous about tax implications and convinced it could rise further. Gambling, Not Strategy Personal finance experts Dave Ramsey and George Kamel discussed

content.title: She's Holding Onto $650K In Tesla Stock, Waiting For It To Hit $1M. Dave Ramsey Says, 'I'm Not Dissing Tesla, But I'm Not Buying It'
content.summary: A woman who worked at Tesla for six years is sitting on $650,000 worth of company stock, and she’s hoping it grows to $1 million before she sells. The 37-year-old project engineer earns $70,000 a year, rents for $1,000 a month, and has $20,000 in debt she plans to pay off this year. Despite having no cash savings, she’s holding onto the stock, nervous about tax implications and convinced it could rise further. Gambling, Not Strategy Personal finance experts Dave Ramsey and George Kamel discussed
